body_html:
@martinwicke Is there potentially something wrong with Jenkins - XLA failure cites docker device space issues:

Successfully built e0b6e2dbd179
Running 'tensorflow/tools/ci_build/xla/linux/gpu/run_py3.sh' inside jenkins-tensorflow-pull-requests-xla-2627.gpu...
docker: Error response from daemon: devmapper: Thin Pool has 977073 free data blocks which is less than minimum required 983040 free data blocks. Create more free space in thin pool or use dm.min_free_space option to change behavior.
See 'docker run --help'.
Build step 'Execute shell' marked build as failure

and the mac failure is what looks like all of the Python-based tests; WRT the latter, i suppose @andrewcmyers could have merged down from master when master was broken, but given that so many tests are failing, it seems like something more Jenkins-systemic is afoot.

body:
@martinwicke Is there potentially something wrong with Jenkins - XLA failure cites docker device space issues:
```
Successfully built e0b6e2dbd179
Running 'tensorflow/tools/ci_build/xla/linux/gpu/run_py3.sh' inside jenkins-tensorflow-pull-requests-xla-2627.gpu...
docker: Error response from daemon: devmapper: Thin Pool has 977073 free data blocks which is less than minimum required 983040 free data blocks. Create more free space in thin pool or use dm.min_free_space option to change behavior.
See 'docker run --help'.
Build step 'Execute shell' marked build as failure
```
and the mac failure is what looks like all of the Python-based tests; WRT the latter, i suppose @andrewcmyers could have merged down from master when master was broken, but given that so many tests are failing, it seems like something more Jenkins-systemic is afoot.
